bib.title: A volunteer design methodology of data warehouses
bib.citation: Conceptual Modeling: 37th International Conference, ER 2018, Xi'an, China …, 2018
bib.author: Amir Sakka and Sandro Bimonte and Lucile Sautot and Guy Camilleri and Pascale Zaraté and Aurelien Besnard
bib.conference: Conceptual Modeling: 37th International Conference, ER 2018, Xi'an, China, October 22–25, 2018, Proceedings 37
bib.abstract: In the context of Volunteered Geographic Information (VGI), volunteers are not involved in the decisional processes. Moreover, VGI systems do not offer advanced historical analysis tools. Therefore, in this work, we propose to use Data Warehouse (DW) and OLAP systems to analyze VGI data, and we define a new DW design methodology that allows involving volunteers in the definition of analysis needs over VGI data. We validate it using a real biodiversity case study.
